d.title: 🐛 Handle non-existing user IDs in `read_user_by_id`
d.body:
Fix an issue where `read_user_by_id` would fail to return if the requested user ID did not exist.
* Return `404 - Not Found` when ID does not exist.
* Request without sufficient permission will always result in `403 - Unauthorized`.
* Add tests to test requesting non-existing user IDs as superuser and normal user.

d.title: 🐛 Fix `parse_cors` function to be consistent for both empty string and empty list
d.body:
Fix the `parse_cors` function in `config.py` so that it behaves consistently for both empty string and empty list.
Currently, when an empty list is provided as an argument, it returns an empty list (`[]`). However, when an empty string (`""`) is provided, it returns a list with an empty string (`[""]`) and starting the FastAPI application fails.

d.title: 🐛 Fix reset behavior in `EditItem` mutation on success

labels.name: conflicts
labels.description: Automatically generated when a PR has a merge conflict

d.body: This PR fixes a bug where the ItemUpdateForm (in EditItem) would reset to its default values upon successful mutation. As a result, reopening the update form would display outdated predefined values. The fix ensures the form state is correctly updated with the latest item data after a successful update.

d.title: 🐛 Fix Poetry installation in Dockerfile and upgrade Python version and packages to fix Docker build
d.body:
The poetry installation url has to be updated as the old one is no longer valid.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45064840/194695638-03882c4f-baa1-467f-91d9-a0b08ed4cfe3.png)

And replace a poetry install option `--no-dev` with a recommended one `--only main`.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45064840/194695641-11692f3f-82e3-4532-a9d9-ff4871c72851.png)

d.title: 📌 Fix flower Docker image, pin version
d.body: Lowering flower version to solve issue #294

d.title: 🐛 Ensure frontend waits for backend and redirect unauthenticated users

labels.name: conflicts
labels.description: Automatically generated when a PR has a merge conflict

d.body:
- Add depends_on to frontend service to wait for backend healthcheck
- Add beforeLoad guard to dashboard route to redirect to login when not authenticated
- Prevents nginx 'host not found' errors and infinite loading spinner

d.title: 🐛 Close sidebar drawer on user selection
d.body:
Issue (on mobile/small screens): The SidebarItems component has an onClose prop that's being passed to the RouterLink onClick handler, but in the Sidebar component, we are not passing this prop to SidebarItems. 

Fix: Now when a user clicks on any navigation item in the sidebar or the logout button, the drawer will automatically close as the new page loads. The onClose function is passed to each RouterLink in the SidebarItems component, which will trigger when a user clicks on a menu option.

d.title: fix: #400 logout because token expired or corrupted

labels.name: conflicts
labels.description: Automatically generated when a PR has a merge conflict

d.body: Rename state `error` to get `useQuery`'s native `error` via object destructuring to solve the spinner endless loop in case of backend reboot, expired or corrupted token.

d.title: ♻️ Fix tests when first superuser password is changed in .env
d.body:
The `test_reset_password` test changes user password. It will break other tests becuase `get_superuser_token_headers` function won't able to get access_token.

It relates to #217

d.title: 🐛 Fix Celery worker command
d.body:
The config for celery changed, and the worker wouldn't start. The -A option had to be moved from the worker to celery itself.
fix #444

d.title: 🐛 Fix `EMAILS_FROM_NAME` type to be `str` instead of `EmailStr`
d.body: `EMAILS_FROM_NAME` has default `PROJECT_NAME`, which is a string like "Full Stack FastAPI Project" and not a valid email address. Therefore, the type of `EMAILS_FROM_NAME` should be changed from email to str.

d.title: 🐛 Fix loginAccessToken Prop in useAuth.ts to Resolve 400 Error on dashboard login
d.body: This pull request fixes an HTTP 400 error in production by updating the login function in frontend/src/hooks/useAuth.ts. The LoginService.loginAccessToken call was incorrectly passing { formData: data } instead of { formData: { data.username, data.password } }, causing a type mismatch and sending multipart/form-data instead of application/x-www-form-urlencoded. The change ensures compliance with the LoginLoginAccessTokenData type and corrects the login request format.

d.title: 🐛 Fix required password validation when editing user fields
🐛 Add user authentication check in admin route to restrict access for non-superusers
d.body: 🐛 Add user authentication check in admin route to restrict access for non-superusers

d.title: 🐛 Fix test failed after test_reset_password if user use own password
d.body:
If user set password of FIRST_SUPERUSER_PASSWORD to a different value of "changethis" in .env file, after run test_reset_password case, the password will be changed to "changethis" becasue it hardcorded in this testcase.
Following testcases will all be failed because of wrong password.
Change it to reset to password in .env file.

d.title: 🧑‍🔧 Replace correct value for 'htmlFor'
d.body:
Hi, this is my first PR here. Let me know if I can do anything better, I did not find contribution guide.

This PR fixes link between email label and input field in signup page.

d.title: 🐛 Change get_user_by_email to be case insensetive
d.body: Fix an issue where `get_user_by_email`  won't return a user object if the requested email case doesn't match the string in the database.

d.title: 🐛 Fix welcome page to show logged-in user
d.body:
Use up-to-date logged-in user value from `useAuth`, instead of stale query data.
`useAuth` correctly refreshes, and holds the up-to-date value of the currently logged-in user.

This is fixing the following issue:
1. User A is logged in, welcome screen is correct (Hi, A 👋🏼)
2. User A logs off
3. User B logs in, welcome screen is wrongly still showing A's welcome screen (Hi, A 👋🏼)
4. Refresh the page, and welcome screen is showing correctly (Hi, B 👋🏼)

d.title: 🐛 Fix local Traefik proxy network config to fix Gateway Timeouts
d.body:
The network config of the proxy service for the local docker setup (docker-compose.override.yaml) is missing and therefore the proxy service can't reach the backend service (produces Gateway Timeouts).

See https://github.com/tiangolo/full-stack-fastapi-template/discussions/1183
